pullRequest.title: Don't start Rubix server by default on coordinator
pullRequest.bodyText:
In real deployments Rubix on coordinator is not
part of caching node pool. This pollutes coordinator
log with Rubix error messages whenever coordinator reads
a file (e.g ACID version file). This commit disables
caching on coordinator by default. Caching on coordinator
can still be enabled via feature toggle for development
purpose.

nodes.bodyText:
This means that we no longer need cache directory on coordinator if this property is set to false.
Can you please update documentation accordingly?

The commit message is misleading. We are still startin up rubix server on coordinator to get statistics from workers.
Please be more specific.
I think it will be more readable if this was called from startRubix. Technically it is also starting of rubix services. We just start a subset of those on coordinator.
Cache directories are still validated in setupServer, so it's still required to have cache directory on coordinator
We don't start servers themselves. We just setup them and have metrics registered.

I think it will be more readable if this was called from startRubix

We don't start server (no sockets are opened), we just set it up and register metrics.

commit.message:
Don't start Rubix server by default on coordinator

In real deployments Rubix on coordinator is not
part of caching node pool. This pollutes coordinator
log with Rubix error messages whenever coordinator reads
a file (e.g ACID version file). This commit disables
caching on coordinator by default. Caching on coordinator
can still be enabled via feature toggle for development
purpose.
